      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Stop the the Vertx instance and release any resources held by it.

        The instance cannot be used after it has been closed.

        The actual close is asynchronous and may not complete until after the call has returned.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Vertx

      • close

        public void close(Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> completionHandler)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Like Vertx.close() but the completionHandler will be called when the close is complete
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • deployVerticle

        public void deployVerticle(Verticle verticle)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Deploy a verticle instance that you have created yourself.

        Vert.x will assign the verticle a context and start the verticle.

        The actual deploy happens asynchronously and may not complete until after the call has returned.

        Specified by:
        deployVerticle in interface Vertx
        Parameters:
        verticle - the verticle instance to deploy.

      • deployVerticle

        public void deployVerticle(Verticle verticle,
                           Handler<AsyncResult<String>> completionHandler)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Like Vertx.deployVerticle(Verticle) but the completionHandler will be notified when the deployment is complete.

        If the deployment is successful the result will contain a string representing the unique deployment ID of the deployment.

        This deployment ID can subsequently be used to undeploy the verticle.

        Specified by:
        deployVerticle in interface Vertx
        Parameters:
        verticle - the verticle instance to deploy
        completionHandler - a handler which will be notified when the deployment is complete

      • deployVerticle

                           Handler<AsyncResult<String>> completionHandler)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Like Vertx.deployVerticle(String) but the completionHandler will be notified when the deployment is complete.

        If the deployment is successful the result will contain a String representing the unique deployment ID of the deployment.

        This deployment ID can subsequently be used to undeploy the verticle.

        Specified by:
        deployVerticle in interface Vertx
        Parameters:
        name - The identifier
        completionHandler - a handler which will be notified when the deployment is complete

      • deployVerticle

        public void deployVerticle(String name)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Deploy a verticle instance given a name.

        Given the name, Vert.x selects a VerticleFactory instance to use to instantiate the verticle.

        For the rules on how factories are selected please consult the user manual.

        Specified by:
        deployVerticle in interface Vertx
        Parameters:
        name - the name.

      • executeBlocking

        public <T> void executeBlocking(Action<T> action,
                                Handler<AsyncResult<T>> resultHandler)
        Specified by:
        executeBlocking in interface VertxSPI

      • executeBlocking

        public <T> void executeBlocking(Handler<Future<T>> blockingCodeHandler,
                                Handler<AsyncResult<T>> asyncResultHandler)
        Description copied from interface: Vertx
        Safely execute some blocking code.

        Executes the blocking code in the handler blockingCodeHandler using a thread from the worker pool.

        When the code is complete the handler resultHandler will be called with the result on the original context (e.g. on the original event loop of the caller).

        A Future instance is passed into blockingCodeHandler. When the blocking code successfully completes, the handler should call the Future.complete(T) or Future#complete(T) method, or the Future.fail(java.lang.Throwable) method if it failed.

        Specified by:
        executeBlocking in interface Vertx
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result
        Parameters:
        blockingCodeHandler - handler representing the blocking code to run
        asyncResultHandler - handler that will be called when the blocking code is complete
